byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and STEVEN ERLANGER

lead_paragraph: The president, speaking alongside Prime Minister David Cameron, said a Britain outside the bloc would move to the “back of the queue” for a trade deal with the United States.

headline.print_headline: Obama Warns Britain That Trade Might Suffer if It Leaves European Union
headline.main: Obama Warns Britain on Trade if It Leaves European Union

snippet: The president, speaking alongside Prime Minister David Cameron, said a Britain outside the bloc would move to the “back of the queue” for a trade deal with the United States.
abstract: Pres Obama, during visit to Great Britain, urges country to vote in June referendum to remain in European Union, taking unusually strong position on another country's politics; warns economic relations with United States may change if Britain exits union.
